channel.title: Multi Tenancy support on Redash
channel.description:
Our scenario is that we have a tenancy model including multiple tenants using the same postgres database, only discriminated by a table-level tenant id.
So, Is there a possibility to intercept the queries that Redash fires in order to append a tenant id to the where clause by tweaking the celery threads within? Will there be any caching issues?
or do we need to use different schema's per each tenant?
Any advice on potential techniques or alternate approaches here? Thanks in advance for any help.

item.title: Multi Tenancy support on Redash
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
That’s what organizations were built for, yes. But it’s the wild west and undocumented.

Read full topic

item.title: Multi Tenancy support on Redash
item.dc:creator: kurianbenoy-aot
item.description:
@jesse is organisations concept in Redash supporting multi-tenancy?

Read full topic

item.title: Multi Tenancy support on Redash
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Redash doesn’t support multi-tenancy like this. There are some features built-in for our use operating app.redash.io but it’s never been supported for the community users

Read full topic
